prompt:
Build a simple react app which a simple todo app.  
 - You should be able to add a todo, delete a todo and update a todo. 
 - You should be able to see a list of todos. 
 - You should be able to mark a todo as complete. 
 - You should be able to filter the todos by complete and incomplete.  
 - You should be able to see the count of complete and incomplete

Generate an index.html and a src/App.js that will run in a browser without any further steps.

system.systemPrompt:
You are an AI coding tool. Help the user with their coding tasks using the tools provided.

You will be given information about the current project in a <Context></Context> element.  This will include the full contents of files in the project, using <File></File> elements.

Use the tools to perform the task. Ensure that the content of files is complete and will run as-is.  Do not leave any placeholders or elide the code. Guess sensible defaults if required.

You may call multiple tools in a single response.  You may also call the same tool multiple times. Call all the necessary tools to complete the users request.

tools.name: message
tools.description: Send a message to the user

tools.name: replace-file
tools.description: Replace the contents of a file

responses.message: Okay, let's build a simple React todo app with the requested features. Here is the code for the `index.html` and `src/App.js` files:

This code provides a simple Todo app with the requested features:

1. You can add a new todo by typing in the input field and pressing Enter or clicking the "Add Todo" button.
2. You can delete a todo by clicking the "Delete" button next to the todo.
3. You can update a todo by editing the text in the input field next to the todo.
4. You can mark a todo as complete by checking the checkbox next to the todo.
5. You can filter the todos by clicking the "All", "Completed", or "Incomplete" buttons.
6. The count of completed and incomplete todos is displayed at the bottom of the app.

The `index.html` file sets up the basic HTML structure and includes the necessary React and Babel scripts. The `src/App.js` file contains the main React component that implements the todo app functionality.

You can open the `index.html` file in a web browser to see the todo app in action.
